I'm not totally sure about this but I think all you need to do is 
use energy = 'off' option in a constant pressure reactor 
simulation.

Typically this is how, isothermal reactors are built in cantera 
(reactors.pdf in Cantera documents on sourceforge)

A high value of wall const K (pressure sensitive) makes sure that 
the pressure in the reactor stays constant and energy= 'off' would 
take care of keeping temperature constant.

r   = Reactor(gas, energy= 'off')

Hope that helps.

Regards,

Bhupinder

On Wed May 03 16:30:55 EDT 2006, Eric  <ehuelson@...> 
wrote:

> Fairly new to Cantera and just starting to jump from equilibrium 
> states of reactions to using the reactor functions given in the 
> MATLAB demo software. I am going down this route to decrease our 
> reliance on Chemkin, specifically the Aurora code in Chemkin. So 
> my question, does anyone know where to find, or have any MATLAB 
> reactor code for a constant temperature and pressure situation? 
> Any help or suggestions would be appreciated.
